description: Alexei Navalny tells the BBC his poisoning has left him struggling with sleep and muscular control.
title: Navalny poisoning: Kremlin critic recalls near-death Novichok torment
title_page: Navalny poisoning: Kremlin critic recalls near-death Novichok torment - BBC News
maintext: "For a long time I had hallucinations," he said. He believed his wife Yulia, doctors and his fellow activist Leonid Volkov were telling him he had been in an accident, he had lost his legs, "the surgeon was going to give me new legs and a new spine".
